title: Directs the commissioner of the department of motor vehicles to issue renewal notices; provides notice of county retention of fee
summary: Directs the commissioner of the department of motor vehicles to issue renewal notices to residents issued a driver's license, learner's permit and identification card; provides notice that the county clerk retains 12.7 percent of the fee if such renewal is processed by the county.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         4157

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   February 1, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. MOLINARO -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Transportation

       AN  ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to the renewal
         of driver's licenses, learner's permits and identification cards

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  503 of the vehicle and traffic law is amended by
    2  adding a new subdivision 5 to read as follows:
    3    5. NOTICE TO RENEW. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL  MAIL  RENEWAL  NOTICES  TO
    4  RESIDENTS  ISSUED A DRIVER'S LICENSE OR A LEARNER'S PERMIT FORTY-FIVE TO
    5  SIXTY DAYS BEFORE SUCH DRIVER'S LICENSE  OR  LEARNER'S  PERMIT  EXPIRES.
    6  THE  RENEWAL  NOTICE SHALL DETAIL THE METHODS AVAILABLE FOR RENEWAL, THE
    7  ADDRESS OF THE NEAREST DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES  OFFICE,  AND  SHALL
    8  STATE "PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION 3 OF SECTION 205 OF THE VEHICLE AND TRAF-
    9  FIC LAW, THE COUNTY CLERK SHALL RETAIN 12.7 PERCENT OF RENEWAL FEES IF A
   10  RENEWAL  IS  PROCESSED  BY  A DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES BRANCH OFFICE
   11  OPERATED BY THE COUNTY. THESE FUNDS MAY BE USED TO PROVIDE VITAL  COUNTY
   12  SERVICES AND/OR REDUCE COUNTY PROPERTY TAXES."
   13    S 2. Section 491 of the vehicle and traffic law is amended by adding a
   14  new subdivision 3 to read as follows:
   15    3.  NOTICE  TO  RENEW.  THE COMMISSIONER SHALL MAIL RENEWAL NOTICES TO
   16  RESIDENTS ISSUED AN IDENTIFICATION CARD FORTY-FIVE TO SIXTY DAYS  BEFORE
   17  SUCH  IDENTIFICATION  CARD  EXPIRES. THE RENEWAL NOTICE SHALL DETAIL THE
   18  METHODS AVAILABLE FOR RENEWAL, THE ADDRESS OF THE NEAREST DEPARTMENT  OF
   19  MOTOR  VEHICLES  OFFICE,  AND  SHALL STATE "PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION 3 OF
   20  SECTION 205 OF THE VEHICLE AND  TRAFFIC  LAW,  THE  COUNTY  CLERK  SHALL
   21  RETAIN  12.7  PERCENT  OF  RENEWAL  FEES  IF A RENEWAL IS PROCESSED BY A
   22  DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES  BRANCH  OFFICE  OPERATED  BY  THE  COUNTY.
   23  THESE  FUNDS  MAY BE USED TO PROVIDE VITAL COUNTY SERVICES AND/OR REDUCE
   24  COUNTY PROPERTY TAXES."
   25    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07968-02-1
